article.title: Community Map Builder Software Design Description

abstract.para: This document describes the design of Community Map Builder.

listitem.para: An open source framework for communities to collectively edit geographic data.
Javascript and XSL modular libraries (called mapbuilder-lib) which can be integrated to build geographic widgets. The widgets implement clients to Open GIS Consortium (OGC) services.
Specific OGC clients which have been built using Mapbuilder widgets.

section.title: Framework
section.para: The Mapbuilder framework is designed for collaborative, open sharing of place-based information. It builds upon components that conform to Open GIS's international Standards for geospatial software development. It provides business logic components using Open Source, OpenGIS-compliant components for this effort. Map serving uses the OpenGIS Web Map Server-compliant software, Mapserver. Spatial feature updating uses the OpenGIS Web Feature Server-compliant software Geoserver, which relies upon Postgres and the PostGIS component as its spatial database. Mapbuilder also uses Postgres as a normal database to store community-contributed text and photographs.
Community Mapbuilder is more than just a collection of technologies. It is a collection of Web pages, server applications and database schema, along with implementation recommendations.
